result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody J. Derks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody J. Derks in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF239 & 15CM247 @ 10:05 am.  State gives plea agreement, 15CF239, ct 1 & ct 2 DRI, 15CM247 DRI.  15CF239 withheld sentence 2 years probation, AODA and follow through, costs, DNA surcharge and sample.  Atty Laska and def. agree with plea agreement. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights. Def. understands charge and penalties.  15CF239 Ct 1 Poss of Meth, no contest plea.  DRI in ct 2.  15CM247 DRI.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Laska is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Poss of Meth in ct 1 in 15CF239.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Atty Laska gives sentencing recommendation.  Def. makes statement.  
Court accepts plea agreement and orders 15CF239, Ct 1 withheld sentence 2 years probation, AODA and follow through, costs, DNA Sample and 250.00 Surcharge.  Credit for 64 days if revoked.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Bond to be applied. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Cody J. Derks in court via video with attorney Cana G Laska appearing by telephone .  Defendant Cody J. Derks in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM247 and 15CF239 @ 2:11 p.m. Atty Laska gives arguments for reduction of cash bond. Response by State. Court will reduce bond. Off the record for scheduling. Back on the record. Prelim hrg date set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Cody J. Derks in court via video, with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Cody J. Derks in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CF239 & 15CM247.  Special appearance by Atty Schuster  Complaints received, reviewed. 15CM247 case Not guilty plea entered.  Arguments for bond presented by Atty Schuster.  Court will receive not guilty plea on 15CM247.  Response by State for bond.   Def states address on record.   State would agree to $1000 cash bond.  Court will reduce bond.   Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  Def agrees.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cody J. Derks in court,via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF239 & 15CM247.  Def has contacted the public defenders office.  Review of bond, court will continue bond that was previously set on Friday.  Court will adjourn.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription, and take as prescribed

Defendant Cody J. Derks in court,  via video in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   New complaint filed.  Def has copy of complaint.   Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  Def request an atty.  15CM247 also called by court.   Same appearances.  State request warrant be vacated.  Court will vacate warrant.  State gives recommendations for bond.  Requesting $2500.00 with conditions.  Court reads charge with possible penalties for 15CM247.  Court sets bond, bond will cover both files  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cody J. Derks not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file.   Unable to serve.  State request warrant, Bond $500.00 or body    Adjacent counties.  So ordered by Court
